notes_translated.fr-t-en: Fournit un profil temporel du nombre de visites d'urgence par jour de la semaine. Les données couvrent les niveaux de triage des visites d'urgence semi-urgentes et non urgentes au cours du dernier exercice financier disponible pour les patients résidant dans la région géographique locale. L'Échelle canadienne de triage et de gravité (ETG) est une échelle permettant de classer les patients selon le type et la gravité de leurs signes et symptômes initiaux au service des urgences, ce qui aide à déterminer les priorités de traitement. L'ETG sert à déterminer le niveau de triage. Il y a 5 niveaux, le niveau 1 étant le plus urgent et le niveau 5 le moins urgent. Cet ensemble de données sur les indicateurs contient de l'information aux niveaux de la région géographique locale (par exemple, Lacombe, Red Deer, Calgary West Bow, etc.) et de l'Alberta. Par zone géographique locale, on entend 132 zones géographiques créées par Alberta Health (AH) et Alberta Health Services (AHS) en fonction des limites du recensement. Ce tableau fait partie du rapport "Alberta Health Primary Health Care - Community Profiles" publié en mars 2015.
notes_translated.en: Provides a time profile of the number of emergency visits by day of the week. Data covers both semi-urgent and non-urgent emergency visit triage levels during the most recent fiscal year available for patients residing in the local geographic area. Canadian Triage and Acuity Scale (CTAS) is a scale to categorize patients according to the type and severity of their initial presenting signs and symptoms at the Emergency Department that helps to determine priorities for treatment. The CTAS is used to determine the triage level. There are 5 levels, with level 1 being the most urgent and level 5 the least urgent. This indicator dataset contains information at both Local Geographic Area (for example, Lacombe, Red Deer, Calgary West Bow, etc.) and Alberta levels. Local geographic area refers to 132 geographic areas created by Alberta Health (AH) and Alberta Health Services (AHS) based on census boundaries. This table is the part of "Alberta Health Primary Health Care - Community Profiles" report published March 2015.

subject: health_and_safety

Canadian Triage and Acuity Scale (CTAS) is a scale to categorize patients according to the type and severity of their initial presenting signs and symptoms at the Emergency Department that helps to determine priorities for treatment. The CTAS is used to determine the triage level. There are 5 levels, with level 1 being the most urgent and level 5 the least urgent. This indicator dataset contains information at both Local Geographic Area (for example, Lacombe, Red Deer, Calgary West Bow, etc.) and Alberta levels. Local geographic area refers to 132 geographic areas created by Alberta Health (AH) and Alberta Health Services (AHS) based on census boundaries.
